Michael Gove , the Education Secretary, said "profound mistakes" made with the curriculum by Labour led to England plummeting in international league tables. Writing in The Daily Telegraph today, he said: The top-performing education nations all have rigorous curricula which act as a benchmark for achievement and a guide to essential knowledge. "But while we have one of the biggest curricula in the world- at nearly 500 pages- it has failed a generation by not preparing them for the modern world. "The existing national curriculum embodies poverty of aspiration. A new primary and secondary school curriculum is expected to be in place by September 2013. You can never erase that, but you can sure help change others from falling into that same problem. A star in Atlanta for most of his six seasons as a Falcon after being selected first overall in the 2001 draft, Michael Vick missed 2007 and 2008 while incarcerated for 18 months in a federal prison.
